title.narrative: INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING

description.narrative: institutional capacities and higher participation of relevant stakeholders of child protection are increase, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable children and child victims of exploitation, trafficking, violence and harmful practices are identified and protected by holistic, equitable policy interventions that are responsive to their individual needs, including in humanitarian situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: institutional capacities and higher participation of relevant stakeholders of child protection are increase

description.narrative: Almost 1000 state and non-state protection actors were reached through the activities to disseminate the legal framework for the protection of children and women. The heads of the listening and protection services for children and women victims of violence received thematic trainings. The contracts of the three United Nations Volunteers (UNVs) in charge of the promotion and protection of the rights of the child were renewed in 2021 for another ;year until 31 December ;2022, ;to continue strengthening the capacities of the regional directorates in charge of protection. | Status:Met | As-of Date:10/01/2022
